label: Behavior 98992407
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a secondorder polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.6690 + 0.0085 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 15.3087 + 0.1078 × t + 0.0009 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed of approximately 10.9–11.0 knots throughout the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG increases slowly and consistently from 80.0° to 82.0°, indicating a smooth, progressive turn to the right)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains fixed at 82.0°, showing no oscillation or abrupt changes)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a secondorder polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.6690 + 0.0085 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 15.3087 + 0.1078 × t + 0.0009 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
